summary: Geochemistry, a vital discipline within natural and applied sciences, involves the study of the chemical composition and processes of Earth materials. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, geochemical analyses are essential for prospecting and evaluating natural resources, ensuring compliance with environmental standards. Instruments like chromatographs and detectors are employed to examine samples, characterizing their solid and gaseous components. The importation of geochemical materials is subject to specific duties and tariffs, justified by their scientific significance. Regulatory representatives must confer with experts to ensure that educational and research objectives are met, invoking requisite standards for safety and sustainability in the EU.
